    • Field Detail

      • RETRY_ONLY_ONCE

        public static final RetryPolicy RETRY_ONLY_ONCE
        Retry Policy to just do one try.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static RetryPolicy of​(int count,
                             long ms)
        Create a new RetryPolicy with constant wait time.

        For example, 

         RetryPolicy incremental = RetryPolicies.of(3, 12);
        Then following of (re-)tries will be (maximum retries):
        1. Do a first try
        2. Wait 12 ms
        3. Do a second retry
        4. Wait 12 ms
        5. Do a third retry
        Parameters:
        count - the number of retry.
        ms - the constant wait time in ms.
        Returns:
        the RetryPolicy

      • of

        public static RetryPolicy of​(int count,
                             long value,
                             TimeUnit unit)
        Create a new RetryPolicy with constant wait time.

        For example, 

         RetryPolicy incremental = RetryPolicies.of(3, 15, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
        Then following of (re-)tries will be (maximum retries):
        1. Do a first try
        2. Wait 15 ms
        3. Do a second retry
        4. Wait 15 ms
        5. Do a third retry
        Parameters:
        count - the number of retry.
        value - the wait time
        unit - the unit of the wait time.
        Returns:
        the RetryPolicy

      • of

        public static RetryPolicy of​(int count,
                             Duration duration)
        Create a new RetryPolicy with constant wait time.

        For example, 

         RetryPolicy incremental = RetryPolicies.of(3, Duration.ofMillis(10));
        Then following of (re-)tries will be (maximum retries):
        1. Do a first try
        2. Wait 10 ms
        3. Do a second retry
        4. Wait 10 ms
        5. Do a third retry
        Parameters:
        count - the number of retry.
        duration - the constant duration to wait.
        Returns:
        the RetryPolicy

      • of

        public static RetryPolicy of​(int count,
                             IntToLongFunction retryToWaitTime)
        Create a new RetryPolicy, by using a generic function to compute the retry duration.

        For example, using this definition : 

         RetryPolicy incremental = RetryPolicies.of(3, c -> (long) (Math.random() * 100));
        Then following of (re-)tries will be (maximum retries):
        1. Do a first try
        2. Wait a random time between 0 and 100 ms
        3. Do a second retry
        4. Wait a random time between 0 and 100 ms
        5. Do a third retry
        Parameters:
        count - the number of retry. A value of 1 is to do only one try, without sleep.
        retryToWaitTime - the function to compute the wait time based on the retry. The received value by this function starts with 1, and this will be the first retry (meaning a the initial try has been done before).
        Returns:
        the RetryPolicy

      • ofIncremental

        public static RetryPolicy ofIncremental​(int count,
                                        long ms)
        Create a new RetryPolicy, that wait each time more time : first time the received duration, second time twice, etc.

        For example, using this definition : 

         RetryPolicy incremental = RetryPolicies.ofIncremental(3, 20);
        Then following of (re-)tries will be (maximum retries):
        1. Do a first try
        2. Wait 20ms
        3. Do a second retry
        4. Wait 40ms
        5. Do a third retry
        Parameters:
        count - the number of retry.
        ms - the time in ms that will be combined with the retry number
        Returns:
        the RetryPolicy

      • ofIncremental

        public static RetryPolicy ofIncremental​(int count,
                                        Duration duration)
        Create a new RetryPolicy, that wait each time more time : first time the received duration, second time twice, etc.

        For example, using this definition : 

         RetryPolicy incremental = RetryPolicies.ofIncremental(3, Duration.ofMillis(50));
        Then following of (re-)tries will be (maximum retries):
        1. Do a first try
        2. Wait 50ms
        3. Do a second retry
        4. Wait 100ms
        5. Do a third retry
        Parameters:
        count - the number of retry.
        duration - the duration that will be combined with the retry number
        Returns:
        the RetryPolicy
